column4: v`laptop : the via 3d system won't work with any linux system. It's a medion laptop, a very cheap one, one year old. It sucks, but it's nothing more than what i need to study
are you SURE it won't work? via has released drivers for various things
sure
what's the name of the chipset your laptop is using?
can't remember
how do i check this ?
try lspci
0000:01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: VIA Technologies, Inc. S3 Unichrome Pro VGA Adapter (rev 02)
i spent a few hours on that...
there's a driver for that, i'm almost positive. i will look
there is one, indeed
didn't work?
but when i use this driver, then my screen remain blank... :'(
it a known bug in xorg-server-via package
ahh that sucks
should have been corrected, but it's not done yet
so basically you don't have a choice but to wait for an update
yeah, especially when i can't watch a fullscreen film :(
exactly
do you know if the bug in the xorg server you use has been fixed upstream yet?
so it hasn't made it into ubuntu then. that sucks
